intro: Gracilea royleana, commonly known as the slender leafed shrub, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan and India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 1,500 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
